member.summary: If not node, then it is an entry.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.Assets.ImportExport.CatalogItemAssetImportExport
member.summary: Implements bulk catalog item asset import/export through serialized objects.
member.remarks: Asset path: For now, it is the file name, which matches up to the Name column in the tblWorkContent table in the CMS database. This may change to use actual file paths (blob paths?) in the future. Asset key: Matches the ContentGUID column in tblContent. This is not exported and is only for internal use. Currently during import/export, the asset key is used to match the file specified by the AssetPath element (in the XML) with image content in the CMS database. Asset type: Currently, this is the qualified class names of applicable content class (IContentImage). This may change to allow users to specify MIME types in the future.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Assets.ImportExport.CatalogItemAssetImportExport.GetAssetType(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the asset type based on the MIME type.
member.returns: The asset type. Currently, this returns "IContentMedia" or "IContentImage".

member.summary: Exports catalog item assets into an XML file to be used for bulk import.
member.param: Path to write the XML export to.

member.summary: Get the assets of entries.

member.summary: Get the assets of nodes.
member.returns: List of CatalogItemAsset.

member.summary: Imports catalog item assets in bulk from a pre-existing XML file.
member.param: Option to overwrite catalog item assets.
member.returns: Returns true if import succeeds.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Assets.ImportExport.CatalogItemAssetImportExport.ImportXml(System.Xml.XmlReader,Mediachase.Commerce.Assets.ImportExport.OverwriteOptionsEnum)
member.summary: Imports catalog item assets in bulk from an XML stream.
member.param: Option to overwrite catalog item assets.
member.returns: Returns true if import succeeds.

members.member:
Save one catalog item asset record to the database.
Object representing a catalog item asset that has been de-serialized from an export. GUID key matching the asset in the CMS database. Option to overwrite catalog item assets. Full path of asset for message display purposes.\ Processed item asset count for message display purposes. Total number of assets for message display purposes.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Assets.ImportExport.CatalogItemAssetImportExport.GetAssetType(Mediachase.Commerce.Assets.ImportExport.CatalogItemAsset)
member.summary: Gets the type of the asset for the catalog item.
member.param: De-serialized object for a catalog item asset.
member.returns: The asset type. It is either explicitly defined or de-referenced by its MIME type or file type.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.Assets.Import.CmsContentMapping
member.summary: An import implementation that will import assets according to the the structure of 'asset folder name' / 'asset group' / 'asset file'.
member.remarks: This is the most efficient way if many product re-use the same image, but may cause maintenance problems if assets are managed from within ECF due to the fact that one image is used in multiple places.

member.summary: Gets existing folder or create folder entity if it does not exist.
member.returns: The FolderEntity.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Assets.Import.ImportBase.GetOrCreateElementEntity(Mediachase.Commerce.Assets.FolderEntity,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the asset or creates it if it does not exist.
member.param: The file path where the asset to import is located.
member.returns: A FolderElementEntity to associate with products/variations.
member.remarks: This method will use an existing asset in ECF with the same name if it is found. However there is no check that this existing asset contains the same data as the asset we're trying to import. If you need to re-import assets with the same name, but new content you need to clear out the asset folder first.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Dto.CatalogEntryDto.CatalogEntryRow.HasPriceValues
member.summary: Returns true if this catalog entry row can return price data via GetPriceValues.
member.returns: True if GetPriceValues will return a valid result, else null.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Dto.CatalogEntryDto.CatalogEntryRow.GetPriceValues
member.summary: Enumerates the price values loaded with this catalog entry row.
member.returns: An enumeration of price values for this catalog entry, or null if prices were not loaded.
member.remarks: Null returns can be avoided by checking the result of HasPriceValues(). If prices were loaded for this DTO but no prices exist for this catalog entry, a non-null empty enumeration will be returned.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.BackgroundTasks.BackgroundTaskManager
member.summary: An in-memory implementation of the interface. This implementation does not persist queued tasks or messages, and queued tasks and progress messages will be lost when the application stops or the application pool is recycled.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.BackgroundTasks.IBackgroundTaskManager
member.summary: Manages safe execution of background tasks, and exposes progress messages from the tasks.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.BackgroundTasks.IBackgroundTaskManager.AddTask(Mediachase.Commerce.BackgroundTasks.IBackgroundTask)
member.summary: Adds a task for the manager to run. The task will be executed immediately if no other tasks are running, or queued if another task is active.
member.returns: The ID of the new task.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.BackgroundTasks.IBackgroundTaskManager.GetMessages(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the messages generated by the specified task. Messages will be returned in same order they were created.
member.param: The ID of the task to query.
member.exception: The specified task ID was not found.
member.returns: A collection of messages generated by the specified task.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.BackgroundTasks.IBackgroundTaskManager.GetMessages(System.Guid,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Mediachase.Commerce.BackgroundTasks.BackgroundTaskMessageType})
member.summary: Gets the messages generated by the specified task, with paging. Messages will be paged by and returned in the same order they were created.
member.param: The ID of the task to query.
The number of messages to skip.
The maximum number of messages to return.
Set to the total number of messages generated by the specified task.
If non-null, only message types contained in the filter will be returned; if null, all message tyeps will be returned.
member.exception: The specified task ID was not found.
member.returns: A collection of messages generated by the specified task.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.BackgroundTasks.IBackgroundTaskManager.GetProgress(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the most recent message generated by the specified task, or null if the task has not generated any messages.
member.param: The ID of the task to query.
member.exception: The specified task ID was not found.
member.returns: The most recent message, or null if the task has not generated any messages.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.BackgroundTasks.IBackgroundTaskManager.QueryTasks(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Guid},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Type},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Mediachase.Commerce.BackgroundTasks.BackgroundTaskStatus})
member.summary: Queries the task manager for known tasks.
member.param: Only return tasks with the specified task IDs; or if null, do not filter by task ID.
Only return tasks with the specified task types; or if null, do not filter by task type.
Only return tasks with the specified task status; or if null, do not filter by task status.
member.returns: A collection of tasks matching the specified filters.

member.param: A factory for final messages added on task completion.

The exception thrown by the task.
member.returns: A final message to add to the message log for the task, or null if no additional message should be added.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.InventoryStatus
member.summary: Represents inventory status.

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.InventoryStatus.Disabled
member.summary: When the Inventory Status is "Disabled", it behaves as if the store is selling digital goods. Any amount can be sold, the requested quantities are updated, but the available counts do not change.

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.InventoryStatus.Enabled
member.summary: When the Inventory Status is "Enabled", it behaves as if we are tracking the inventory of physical goods, which is a limited amount that can be sold. Stock will be required to be available to process orders, and available counts will be decremented as orders are processed.

member.summary: "Sums" up the list of inventories in the parameter. Decimal quantities are added up, while other flags are set based on business logic (e.g. if any of the inventories has AllowBackorder marked as true, the aggregate value for the should be true as well).
member.returns: A single WarehouseInventory object with its fields a "sum" of the list of inventories passed in as the parameter.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.InventoryService.Storage.InventoryServiceCacheBase.CreateCacheKey(System.String,System.Guid,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a cache key for the specified arguments.
member.param: A string identifying the operation producing the value to cache.
The application id for the query.
The arguments for the operation. Each value in arguments must be a string, an int, or an . No more than one element may be a .
member.returns: A cache key for the specified operation, application id, and values.
member.remarks:
The cache key consists of a series of field separated by '$' characters.
The first field is the cache prefix.
The second field is the value of . This value is not processed or escaped in any way.
The fields from , except for any items of type , are added in order. Integer values are added with culture invariant format. Strings are lowercased, and any '$' or '#' characters are escaped with a preceding '#' character. Empty strings are encoded as the sequence "#0".
If contains an item of type , it is added as a series of fields. The fields are added after all other items in . The fields added are the count of items in ; the count of items in ; the items in ; the items in ; and finally the items in with the catalog entry code first and the warehouse code second. All fields are subject to the same lowercasing and escaping as other strings, and the is expected to return distinct, ordered collections.
The is added last, int the N format.

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Inventory.InventoryTrackingStatus.Disabled
member.summary: When the Inventory Status is "Disabled", it behaves as if the store is selling digital goods. Any amount can be sold, the requested quantities are updated, but the available counts do not change.

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Inventory.InventoryTrackingStatus.Enabled
member.summary: When the Inventory Status is "Enabled", it behaves as if we are tracking the inventory of physical goods, which is a limited amount that can be sold. Stock will be required to be available to process orders, and available counts will be decremented as orders are processed.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.InventoryService.BusinessLogic.BackorderProcessor.Apply
member.summary: Applies the request item to the appropriate .

remarks.para: The backorder request item will be marked as a failure if the request date is before either or , of if is false (untracked items cannot be out of stock, so they cannot be backordered).
Successful backorders will apply quantity changes from .

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.InventoryService.BusinessLogic.BackorderProcessor.Validate
member.summary: Validates that the request item is successful.
member.remarks: The backorder request item will be successful if the conditions in are met, and is greater than zero at the beginning of the request.
member.returns: True if the request item is successful; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.InventoryService.BusinessLogic.BackorderProcessor.GetPostValidateChanges
member.summary: Returns the changes applied by the request item.

remarks.para: Successful backorder requests move quantity from to .

Backorder requests apply changes after validation because the value is permitted to go into the negative. If one backorder quantity is available, and a request contains two items backordering five each, the request should succeed -- backorder available is a soft limit since it is not a paid promise to purchase; it is more of a suggestion that the item is in demand. The changes are applied after validation so that the can verify that the original available quantity is greater than zero, and not that the final available quantity is greater than zero.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.InventoryService.BusinessLogic.CancelProcessor.Apply
member.summary: Applies the request item to the appropriate .

remarks.para: The cancel request item will be marked as successful as long as the operation key is valid, even if it refers to a non-existent inventory record. Cancel requests are expected to always work, unless the input is invalid.
Successful cancel requests undo the quantity changes applied by the request item that created the operation key.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.InventoryService.BusinessLogic.CompleteProcessor.Apply
member.summary: Applies the request item to the appropriate .

remarks.para: The complete request item marks a , , or request as completed.
If the original request item was a or , then the requested quantities from the original request are removed; the items have been fulfilled and are no longer pending.

If the original request item was a , then the requested quantity from the original request is removed, decremented from , and added to . This converts a pending backorder request into a pending purchase request.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.InventoryService.BusinessLogic.CompleteProcessor.Validate
member.summary: Validates that the request item is successful.

remarks.para: If the complete request item has a valid operation key and represents a or , the request will succeed.
If the complete request item has a valid oepration key and represents a , then will also verify that there is enough to create a purchase replacing the original backorder.

member.returns: True if the request item is successful; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Applies the request item to the appropriate .

remarks.para: The preorder request item will be marked as a failure if the request date is before or on or after , if the catalog entry is not found, or if the warehouse cannot be determined.
Otherwise, the requested quantity will be decremented from both and ; and added to .

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.InventoryService.BusinessLogic.PreorderProcessor.Validate
member.summary: Validates that the request item is successful.

remarks.para: The preorder request item will be successful if the conditions in are met, and the final is greater than or equal to zero.

Note that the is permitted to become negative. This permits preorders for items that are not yet listed as in stock, while also allowing preorder reqeuests to decrement from available stock when the store has the items but is not yet permitted to sell them.

member.returns: True if the request item is successful; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.InventoryService.InventoryExtensions.GetEntryTotals(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Mediachase.Commerce.InventoryService.InventoryRecord})
member.summary: Groups the elements in by catalog entry code, and aggregates the inventory values for each group into a single .
member.returns: A collection one instance for each distinct catalog entry code, representing an aggregate inventory across all specified records.

remarks.para: All dates and the property are aggregated to the minimum represented value. Other quantities are summed.

If any value in a group has a value of false, then the record representing the group will have set to false, set to the maximum possible value, and set to zero. If the dates for the records indicate that preordering is available, then will be set to the maximum possible value; otherwise, it will be set to zero.

member.summary: Accesses pricing information for catalog entries.

member.summary: Gets the price value identified by .
member.param: The idenfitier for the price value.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Pricing.IPriceDetailService.List(EPiServer.Core.ContentReference)
member.summary: Gets all price details for the .
member.param: A reference to the catalog entity containing the desired prices.
member.returns: A collection of objects associated with the referenced catalog entity.
member.remarks:
The prices returned will vary on the type on entity referenced by the value.
If the value is a category, then prices will be returned for all products and variants in the category, and all variants associated with products in the category.
If the value is a product, then prices will be returned for the product and for all variants associated with the product.
If the value is a variant, then prices will be returned only for the variant.
If the value is a bundle, package, or dynamic package; then prices will be returned for the specified entity, all products and variants in the specified entity, and all variants associated with products in the specified entity.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.ExcludedCatalogEntryMarketsField.UpdateMarketsDictionary(Mediachase.MetaDataPlus.MetaDataContext)
member.summary: Updates the dictionary associated with the metafield to have all market IDs. This does not delete any market IDs that are no longer active; delete functionality may be more difficult to maintain consistency with entries that may have a reference to the delete items.
member.param: The meta data context to access the metadata system with.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.ExcludedCatalogEntryMarketsField.IsValidForMarket(Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Dto.CatalogEntryDto.CatalogEntryRow,Mediachase.Commerce.IMarket)
member.summary: Determines whether or not the current catalog entry is available in a market
member.param: The catalog entry row being evaluated.
The market that is being checked for validity for the field.
member.returns: true if the catalog entry is available in the passed market, or false if is it unavailable
member.remarks: This method does not evaluate whether or not the IMarket is Active. We assume that if an inactive IMarket is passed in then it is a deliberate choice or does not affect the result that should be returned. Currently new entries are available in all markets by default. If this changes (e.g. via customization options) then this method may need to change as well.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.ExcludedCatalogEntryMarketsField.SqlMetaWhereClause(System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection)
member.summary: Creates a SQL clause to filter entries by Market that is compatible with CatalogSearch.SearchEntries's implementation
member.param: The list of markets for which entries must be valid.
member.returns: a formatted string that can be added to a CatalogSearchParameter's SqlMetaWhereClause to filter by market
member.remarks: A catalog entry must be available in every market in the provided collection to be included in the final search results. This string requires the specific CatalogContentProperty table join style used in the default implementations of [ecf_CatalogEntrySearch] and [ecf_CatalogNodesList].

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.Inventory.IWarehouseRepository
member.summary: Accessors for warehouse data

remarks.para: This interface does not support operations on multiple warehouses fully as these are unlikely in a real environment.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Inventory.IWarehouseRepository.List
member.summary: Gets all warehouses.
member.returns: All warehouse records, or null if there are no warehouses defined.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Inventory.IWarehouseRepository.Get(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a specific warehouse.
member.param: The warehouse ID to return data for.
member.returns: The requested warehouse record, or null if the Id does not match an existing warehouse.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Inventory.IWarehouseRepository.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a specific warehouse.
member.param: The warehouse code to return data for.
member.returns: The requested warehouse record, or null if the Code does not match an existing warehouse.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Inventory.IWarehouseRepository.GetDefaultWarehouse
member.summary: Gets the default warehouse.
member.returns: The default warehouse, or null if no warehouses exist.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Inventory.IWarehouseRepository.Save(Mediachase.Commerce.Inventory.IWarehouse)
member.summary: Saves the provided warehouse record.

remarks.para: If the WarehouseId matches the Id of an existing warehouse, the existing record will be updated.
If the WarehouseId is below zero (0) the warehouse is added with a new Id.
If the WarehouseId neither matches the Id of an existing warehouse nor is below zero (0), an Exception will be raised.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Inventory.IWarehouseRepository.Delete(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes a specific warehouse record.
member.param: The catalog entry to delete warehouse for.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.Money
member.summary: Money is an immutable struct type that encapsulates an amount of money and a currency.
member.remarks: To avoid dangerous implicit Currency evaluations, Currency must always be given explicitly. There is one exception and that is when doing an explicit cast from a decimal value to Money. In this case the DefaultCurrencyFunction will be invoked to determine what the current Currency should be. This is implemented to ease the porting of old code to the new Money based system.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters
member.summary: Search parameters that can be specified to control what SQL Command is executed on the server.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters.JoinType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the join used in the query. The example types are: inner join, outer join, left join and right join.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters.JoinSourceTable
member.summary: Gets or sets the join source table. This value has to be a table name that exists in original query. For example it will be CatalogEntry for the Catalog Entry Search or CatalogNode for the Catalog Node Search.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters.JoinTargetQuery
member.summary: Gets or sets the join target query. This can either be a table name or a complete query. For exammple the table name can be something like CatalogEntryEx for the Catalog Entry search. This particular join will allow sorting by meta fields. This is not possible without a join. In some cases the target table can contain multiple records for the same record in source table. That will cause problems with constraints that are inforces by the search DTOs. In order to overcome this, you can specify the query, so if our CatalogEntryEx table had multiple records for one CatalogEntry, we would join it using the follow query: (select distinct ObjectId, DisplayName from CatalogEntryEx) CatalogEntryEx

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters.JoinSourceTableKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the join source table key.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters.JoinTargetTableKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the join target table key.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters.SqlWhereClause
member.summary: Gets or sets the SQL where clause. You can specify filter conditions against the tables returned by the query.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters.SqlMetaWhereClause
member.summary: Gets or sets the SQL meta where clause. You can specify filters for meta tables. Make sure to specifiy columns that exist for items searched.

member.summary: Gets or sets the keyword text search phrase.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Orders.PaymentMethod.SavePaymentParameters(Mediachase.Commerce.Orders.Dto.PaymentMethodDto)
member.summary: Called from the public SaveChanges() method. This performs several steps: 1. It deletes anything from the DTO that is not in the PaymentMethodParameters list. 2. It adds any new entries in the PaymentMethodParameters list. Note: we do not save the PaymentMethodId from the PaymentMethodParameter object. We instead use the read-only value from the current instance of this class This is to ensure that even if the user has modified it, the Parameter remains tied to the current Payment Method.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Orders.PaymentMethod.SaveShippingRestrictions(Mediachase.Commerce.Orders.Dto.PaymentMethodDto)
member.summary: Called from the public SaveChanges() method. This performs several steps: 1. It deletes anything from the DTO that is not in the SaveShippingRestrictions list. 2. It adds any new entries in the SaveShippingRestrictions list. Note: we do not save the PaymentMethodId from the MarketId object. We instead use the read-only value from the current instance of this class This is to ensure that even if the user has modified it, the MarketId remains tied to the current Payment Method.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Orders.PaymentMethod.SaveMarketIds(Mediachase.Commerce.Orders.Dto.PaymentMethodDto)
member.summary: Called from the public SaveChanges() method. This performs several steps: 1. It deletes anything from the DTO that is not in the MarketId list. 2. It adds any new entries in the MarketId list.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.Orders.TransactionType
member.summary: Transaction types for a payment.

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Orders.TransactionType.Authorization
member.summary: Requests to charge a cardholder. An approved Authorization transaction reduces the cardholder’s open-to-buy amount (the amount that can currently be charged against the account), but does not actually capture the funds.

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Orders.TransactionType.Capture
member.summary: Used to complete an Authorization transaction that was successfully authorized through the payment gateway. Note: An Authorization and Capture together are considered one complete transaction. Once the Capture is submitted, the transaction will be sent for settlement.

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Orders.TransactionType.Sale
member.summary: Charges the specified amount against the account, and marks the transaction for immediate funds transfer (capture) during the next settlement period.

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Orders.TransactionType.Void
member.summary: Used to cancel an original transaction that is not yet settled and prevents it from being sent for settlement.

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Orders.TransactionType.Credit
member.summary: Returns the specified amount (posts a credit) to the cardholder’s account.

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Orders.TransactionType.Other
member.summary: Other transaction type.

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Orders.TransactionType.CaptureOnly
member.summary: Used to capture the remaining balance.
member.remarks: In some payment provider, only a single Capture transaction can be submitted against an Authorization, even if we do not capture the full amount with our Capture. If there is an available amount remaining, we may use the Capture Only transaction type to capture the remaining balance.

summary.para: Internal use only, public for testing.
Eliminates overlapping values and assigns MaxQuantity values to a set of price values.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Pricing.Database.PriceGroupOptimizer.OptimizePrices(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Mediachase.Commerce.Pricing.IPriceValue})
member.summary: Returns an optimized list of price values representing the same pricing structure as the supplied price value list.
member.param: The original price list. All values in the list are expected to be for the same catalog entry.
member.returns: An optimized list.
member.remarks: The optimized list will not have any overlapping values, and tiered pricing on quantity will always decrease or stay the same on price as the minimum quantity increases. Two price values overlap if they are for the same catalog entry, market, currency, and customer pricing, and have overlapping validity date ranges. All overlaps are resolved by taking the lower unit price.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Pricing.Database.PriceGroupOptimizer.OptimizePriceGroup(System.Collections.Generic.List{Mediachase.Commerce.Pricing.IPriceValue})
member.summary: Optimizes the price group.
member.param: Group of price values for the same catalog, market, currency and customer pricing
member.returns: An optimized list for a optimizationGroup
member.remarks: This devides price values in a optimizationGroup into optimizedpricevalue segments

member.summary: A comparer for grouping price values in the same price group.

member.summary: A comparer for validity dates. Null will be treated as the end of time, since only ValidUntil may be null.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.ICatalogSystem.StartFindItemsForIndexing(System.Guid,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Initializes a catalog search for indexing.
member.param: The identifier for the current search set. This will be passed back in to get results.
If non null, only entries with a modified date on or after this value will be included in the results.
If non null, only entries with a modified date on or before this value will be included in the results.
member.returns: A count of the number of items that will be returned in the result set.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.ICatalogSystem.ContinueFindItemsForIndexing(System.Guid,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a section of results from StartFindItemsForIndexing.
member.param: The identifier for the search set. The search set must be initialized with with StartFindItemsForIndexing.
The lowest result index to return. Result indexes are 1-based.
The maximum number of results to return.
member.returns: A CatalogEntryDto containing the results.
member.remarks: Once a CatalogEntry is recieved from this call, it will not be returned again. Repeated calls with the same firstResultIndex and maxResultCount will result in empty data sets for all but the first such call.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.ICatalogSystem.DeleteCatalogNodeAndEntries(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes the catalog node and all child nodes (not links) by node id, and deletes all entries that will no longer belong to any nodes. Any or node entry that is under the node and is not deleted, including via links, will have their modified date updated to the current date and time.
member.param: The ID of the catalog node to delete.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.ICatalogSystem.DeleteCatalogNodesAndEntries(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Deletes the catalog nodes and all child nodes (not links), and deletes all entries that will no longer belong to any nodes. Any or node entry that is under the node and is not deleted, including via links, will have their modified date updated to the current date and time.
member.param: The IDs of the catalog nodes to delete.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Impl.CatalogContextImpl.StartFindItemsForIndexing(System.Guid,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Initializes a catalog search for indexing.
member.param: The identifier for the current search set. This will be passed back in to get results.
If non null, only entries with a modified date on or after this value will be included in the results.
If non null, only entries with a modified date on or before this value will be included in the results.
member.returns: A count of the number of items that will be returned in the result set.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Impl.CatalogContextImpl.ContinueFindItemsForIndexing(System.Guid,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a section of results from StartFindItemsForIndexing.
member.param: The identifier for the search set. The search set must be initialized with with StartFindItemsForIndexing.
The lowest result index to return. Result indexes are 1-based.
The maximum number of results to return.
member.returns: A CatalogEntryDto containing the results.
member.remarks: Once a CatalogEntry is recieved from this call, it will not be returned again. Repeated calls with the same firstResultIndex and maxResultCount will result in empty data sets for all but the first such call.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.CatalogContext.DisableVersionSync
member.summary: Gets the value of the DisableVersionSync appSetting, indicating whether an update to Catalog content done outside the Content APIs will remove any version data (e.g. drafts, old published versions...) for the affected Content. Setting this to true can improve the speed of batch operations done through the lower-level API:s (like ICatalogSystem), e.g. the catalog import.
member.value: true to delete all versions; false to update versions if content models are available.

member.summary: Gets the catalog entry.
Gets the catalog entry.
Loads the entries.
Private worker to load the requested details of an entry.
member.param: The catalog entry row representing the entry to be loaded.
The response group describing what parts of the entry to load.
When true, the immediate associations of this entry will be loaded.
When true, and loadAssociations is true, associations will be loaded recursively.
When true, immediate children of the entry will be loaded.
A collection of catalog entry codes to avoid infinite recursion.
A mapping catalog entry id with the entry object to cache.
A collection of catalog entry id to avoid duplicate loading association.
Service interface for the warehouse listing. Passed to reduce load on recursive calls.
Service interface for the stock level tracking system. Passed to reduce load on recursive calls.
member.returns: An entry object representing the catalog entry row, loaded to match the described response group.
member.remarks: The catalog entry response group should be used to select values for loadAssociations, loadAssociationsRecursively, and loadChildren. These values override the settings in the response group.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Objects.Entry
member.summary: The Entry parameter serves as a container element that is a child of the Entries element, and represents the Catalog Entry element, which can be Product, Variation, Bundle or any other type of product.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Objects.Entry.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: The parameterless constructor is intended to be used only when simulating entry data for display or default case purposes, and is not intended to be used when loading persisted data from the database. Please use one of the appropriate parameterized constructors when loading persisted data. The required application information will be determined from the current .

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Objects.Entry.#ctor(System.Guid)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The ID of the associated application context.
member.remarks: See for details. This constructor acts like the non-parameterized version, except it bypasses the resolution of the required ApplicationId field (e.g. for performance reasons).

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Objects.Entry.#ctor(Mediachase.Commerce.Inventory.IWarehouseRepository,Mediachase.Commerce.Inventory.IWarehouseInventoryService,Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Dto.CatalogEntryDto.CatalogEntryRow,Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Managers.CatalogEntryResponseGroup.ResponseGroup)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The inventory service to use to load per-warehouse inventory data.
The warehouse repository service. Used to validate the older Variation table single-warehouse data field.
The catalog entry row being processed.

The response group used to determine the scope of the data being loaded from persisted sources. All data in the provided CatalogEntryDto.CatalogEntryRow will be loaded regardless of this parameter setting to support backwards compatibility. Data from the new warehouse-specific inventory system will be loaded if this parameter includes the Inventory or Full flag.
member.remarks: While the constructors accept dependencies, the dependencies will not be stored with the object, since it is serializable. The code in the contructors should be moved to a factory or controller where dependencies may be managed properly. Data from the new warehouse-specific inventory system will be loaded if this parameter includes the Inventory flag, the Full flag, or the provided CatalogEntryDto.CatalogEntryRow includes an InventoryRow (to support backwards compatibility).

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Objects.Entry.#ctor(Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Dto.CatalogEntryDto.CatalogEntryRow)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Backwards compatible with prior releases.
member.param: The catalog entry row being processed.
member.remarks:
This constructor will be marked obsolete in future releases. Applying service dependency lookups in the constructor can cause performance issues when large numbers of entries are loaded, and should be handled outside the constructor. Please use the
constructor instead. This Entry record will not be marked with any CatalogEntryResponseGroup flags by default.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Objects.Entry.CatalogEntryId
member.summary: Gets or sets the catalog entry ID.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Objects.Entry.ID
member.summary: Gets or sets the Catalog Entry Code.
member.remarks: This is the string catalog entry code. It is not the numeric ID.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Objects.Entry.ApplicationId
member.summary: Gets or sets the application ID.
member.remarks: If the entry was not loaded from the database, this will be Guid.Empty.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Objects.Entry.ResponseGroup
member.summary: Gets the ResponseGroup, which indicates how much related data has been loaded into the Entry.
member.remarks: This flag should be used with care. It is intended as a contract that specifies what related data the Entry has loaded from the database (e.g. Associations, SEO) so that the object can be reused in different contexts. Generally if the entry was not loaded from the database, the Entry object should be used for a specific purpose with a short lifetime where all actions on it are deliberate, and this flag should be null. Data may be set freely independently of this flag setting, and the flag will not change to reflect updates to the fields. This is intended to allow the developer the ability to distinguish between persisted and non-persisted data, so long as the flag is set properly.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Objects.Entry.InventoryStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag indicating how inventory amounts are handled. Must load with Variation response group or will always report as disabled.
member.remarks: Disabled means inventory is not tracked. Ignored means that inventory amounts are tracked but do not affect whether or not an order is accepted, this status does no longer exist from version 8.7 or later. Enabled means that inventory amounts are tracked and orders that exceed current stock levels (possibly incl. backorder amounts) are blocked.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Objects.CatalogNode.ResponseGroup
member.summary: Gets the ResponseGroup, which indicates how much related data has been loaded into the CatalogNode.
member.remarks: This flag should be used with care. It is intended as a contract that specifies what related data the CatalogNode has loaded from the database (e.g. Children, Assets) so that the object can be reused in different contexts. Generally if the node was not loaded from the database, the CatalogNode object should be used for a specific purpose with a short lifetime where all actions on it are deliberate, and this flag should be null. Data may be set freely independently of this flag setting, and the flag will not change to reflect updates to the fields. This is intended to allow the developer the ability to distinguish between persisted and non-persisted data, so long as the flag is set properly.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Impl.CatalogContextProxyImpl.StartFindItemsForIndexing(System.Guid,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Initializes a catalog search for indexing.
member.param: The identifier for the current search set. This will be passed back in to get results.
If non null, only entries with a modified date on or after this value will be included in the results.
If non null, only entries with a modified date on or before this value will be included in the results.
member.returns: A count of the number of items that will be returned in the result set.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Impl.CatalogContextProxyImpl.ContinueFindItemsForIndexing(System.Guid,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a section of results from StartFindItemsForIndexing.
member.param: The identifier for the search set. The search set must be initialized with with StartFindItemsForIndexing.
The lowest result index to return. Result indexes are 1-based.
The maximum number of results to return.
member.returns: A CatalogEntryDto containing the results.
member.remarks: Once a CatalogEntry is recieved from this call, it will not be returned again. Repeated calls with the same firstResultIndex and maxResultCount will result in empty data sets for all but the first such call.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Objects.GiftPromotionReward
member.summary: Gift promotion reward. Allows promotion engine to specify discount that requires item to be added to the cart. The add operation will be performed by the custom code either in workflow activity or front end source code.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Objects.PromotionReward
member.summary: Implements operations for the promotion reward.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Objects.PromotionReward.RewardType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the Reward. The types can be: - WholeOrder will adjust the total for the whole order - AllAffectedEntries will split adjustment between all the entries, so if discount was $50 and there are 5 entries, each one will be discount $10 - EachAffectedEntry will apply full discount to each entry, so if discount was $50 and there are 5 entries the total discount will be $250

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Objects.PromotionReward.AmountOff
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount off.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the amount. Can be either Percentage or Value.

member.summary: Represents Strategy

member.summary: Add item when it does not exist in the cart already, if it does, then simply make it 100% discounted.

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Objects.GiftPromotionReward.Strategy.AlwaysAdd
member.summary: Always adds another item even if one already exists in the cart.

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Objects.GiftPromotionReward.Strategy.NeverAdd
member.summary: Customer must explicitly add item to the cart in order for the promotion to be applied.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.ResourceEnumConverter
member.summary: Defines a type converter for enum values that converts enum values to and from string representations using resources
member.remarks:
This class makes localization of display values for enums in a project easy. Simply derive a class from this class and pass the ResourceManagerin the constructor.
class LocalizedEnumConverter : ResourceEnumConverter { public LocalizedEnumConverter(Type type) : base(type, Properties.Resources.ResourceManager) { } }
Public Class LocalizedEnumConverter
Inherits ResourceEnumConverter Public Sub New(ByVal sType as Type) MyBase.New(sType, My.Resources.ResourceManager) End Sub End Class
Then define the enum values in the resource editor. The names of the resources are simply the enum value prefixed by the enum type name with an underscore separator eg MyEnum_MyValue. You can then use the TypeConverter attribute to make the LocalizedEnumConverter the default TypeConverter for the enums in your project.

member.summary: Get the lookup table for the given culture (creating if necessary)

member.summary: Return the text to display for a simple value in the given culture, uses SharedStrings resource file to lookup enum values
member.param: The enum value to get the text for
member.returns: The localized text

member.summary: Return true if the given value is can be represented using a single bit

member.summary: Return the text to display for a flag value in the given culture

The flag enum value to get the text for
member.returns: The localized text

member.summary: Convert the enum value to a string

member.summary: Convert the given enum value to string using the registered type converter

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.ResourceEnumConverter.GetValues(System.Type,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Return a list of the enum values and their associated display text for the given enum type
member.param: The enum type to get the values for
The culture to get the text for
member.returns: A list of KeyValuePairs where the key is the enum value and the value is the text to display
member.remarks: This method can be used to provide localized binding to enums in ASP.NET applications. Unlike windows forms the standard ASP.NET controls do not use TypeConverters to convert from enum values to the displayed text. You can bind an ASP.NET control to the list returned by this method by setting the DataValueField to "Key" and theDataTextField to "Value".

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.ResourceEnumConverter.GetValues(System.Type)
member.summary: Return a list of the enum values and their associated display text for the given enum type in the current UI Culture
member.param: The enum type to get the values for
member.returns: A list of KeyValuePairs where the key is the enum value and the value is the text to display
member.remarks: This method can be used to provide localized binding to enums in ASP.NET applications. Unlike windows forms the standard ASP.NET controls do not use TypeConverters to convert from enum values to the displayed text. You can bind an ASP.NET control to the list returned by this method by setting the DataValueField to "Key" and theDataTextField to "Value".

member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the cycle. For example to charge customer monthly, set this value to 1 and CycleMode to Months.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Orders.PaymentPlan.MaxCyclesCount

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.Engine.ActivityFlowContextPropertyAttribute
member.summary: This attribute marks a property in an activity or a activity flow class as a context's property and the property will be registered to the . ActivityFlowExecutionContext's property means the property is contained in the ActivityFlow context instead of the Activity.
member.remarks: When applied for an activity's property or activity flow's property, the property value will be populated automatically from context's property. And after the activity has completed, updated value will be persisted to the context's property.
member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to declare a property for a activity flow, which gets and sets value from/to context's property. This is equivalent to this.Context.Property["Warnings"]
[ActivityFlowContextProperty] public StringDictionary Warnings { get; set; }
